question_en: How much time the Module 14 Test of HKICPA QP exam takes? (Search and Answer)
answer_en:
The Module 14 Test of the HKICPA QP exam has a duration of **3 hours**, typically scheduled from **2:30 pm to 5:30 pm**. 

For more details on the timetable and other aspects of the Qualification Programme, you can visit the official HKICPA website:  
[Source: https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Become-a-Hong-Kong-CPA/Qualification-Programme/Timetable]  

If you have further questions about the exam schedule or preparation, feel free to ask!

question_en: Is the Module 14 of HKICPA QP Exam Open Book or not? (Search and Answer)
answer_en:
Yes, Module 14 of the HKICPA QP Exam (Taxation) is an open-book examination. Here are the key details:

1. **Open-Book Format**: Candidates are allowed to bring their own notes, reference books, and stationery (including noiseless and cordless programmable calculators) into the exam. However, computers and electronic dictionaries are not permitted. [Source: [HKICPA](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Membership/Registration/Practising-Certificate/Practising-Certificate-Examinations)]

2. **Exam Duration and Questions**: The exam lasts for 3 hours and consists of written questions, all of which are compulsory. Answers must be provided in English. [Source: [HKICPA](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Membership/Registration/Practising-Certificate/Practising-Certificate-Examinations)]

3. **Preparation Materials**: The syllabus for Module 14 aligns with the PC-Taxation paper, and candidates can refer to the Learning Pack (LP) for Module 14 to prepare. This material is available through the PC Examinations Online Resources Centre (ORC) or can be purchased from the HKICPA service counter. [Source: [HKICPA](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Membership/Registration/Practising-Certificate/Practising-Certificate-Examinations)]

If you need further clarification or additional information, feel free to ask!

question_en: When should I pay my first HKICPA annual fee? (Search and Answer)
answer_en:
The timing for paying your first HKICPA annual fee depends on when you become a CPA:

1. **If you register between January 1 and June 30**:
   - You must pay the full annual fee for that year.

2. **If you register between July 1 and December 31**:
   - You only need to pay half of the annual fee for that year.

The first annual fee is due when you accept the application result and complete your registration as a student or member. Subsequent annual fees are due on or before January 31 each year.

For more details, you can refer to the [HKICPA fee schedule](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Become-a-Hong-Kong-CPA/Qualification-Programme/Fee-schedule) or contact HKICPA directly at renewal@hkicpa.org.hk.

question_en: Do I need working experience to apply for ACCA, or I only have to pass the QP exam? (Search and Answer)
answer_en:
To apply for the ACCA (Association of Chartered Certified Accountants) qualification, you need to meet both the exam requirements and the Practical Experience Requirement (PER). Here's a breakdown:

1. **Exam Requirements**: You must pass the ACCA Qualification exams, which include the Knowledge, Skills, and Professional levels (collectively known as the Qualification Program or QP).

2. **Practical Experience Requirement (PER)**: In addition to passing the exams, you must complete 36 months of relevant work experience. This experience can be gained before, during, or after the exams, but it is mandatory to become a full ACCA member.

### Key Points:
- You can start the ACCA exams without prior work experience.
- However, to become a full ACCA member, you must complete the PER (36 months of relevant work experience) and pass the exams.

For more details, you can refer to the following sources:
- [ACCA Qualification structure and requirements](https://www.accaglobal.com/gb/en/student/getting-started/acca-qualification-structure.html)
- [Practical Experience Requirement FAQs](https://www.accaglobal.com/gb/en/help/student-faqs-practical-experience-requirements.html)

question_en: Is Hongkong's DTA with Armenia already in force or not? (Search and Answer)
answer_en:
Yes, the Double Taxation Agreement (DTA) between Hong Kong and Armenia is currently in force. Here are the key details:

1. **Signing Date**: The DTA was signed on June 24, 2024.  
2. **Entry into Force**: It entered into force on April 9, 2025.  
3. **Effective Date**: The agreement will be effective from the Year of Assessment 2026/2027.  

Hong Kong has also completed the necessary legislative procedures to incorporate the agreement under the Inland Revenue Ordinance.  

For more details, you can refer to the following sources:  
- [Inland Revenue Department of Hong Kong](https://www.ird.gov.hk/eng/tax/dta_inc.htm)  
- [Agreement Details](https://www.ird.gov.hk/eng/tax/dta_armenia.htm)  
- [Full Text of the Agreement](https://www.ird.gov.hk/eng/pdf/Agreement_Armenia_HongKong.pdf)

question_en: Who is the Commissioner of IRD? (Search and Answer)
answer_en: The current Commissioner of the Inland Revenue Department (IRD) is Mr. Benjamin Chan Sze-wai. He will assume the role on October 8, 2024, succeeding Mr. Tam Tai-pang. question_en: How to enroll in HKICPA exam? (Search and Answer)
answer_en:
To enroll in the HKICPA (Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants) exam, follow these steps:

1. **Submit Your Application**:
   - Complete the student application online before the deadline. The application portal is available on the HKICPA website.  
     [Source: [HKICPA Application](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Become-a-Hong-Kong-CPA/New-QP/Application-and-registration)]

2. **Accept Assessment and Registration Offer**:
   - After submitting your application, review and accept the assessment result and registration offer within the specified period.  
     [Source: [HKICPA Timetable](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Become-a-Hong-Kong-CPA/Qualification-Programme/Timetable)]

3. **Enroll for Workshops/Exams**:
   - Use the Student Centre to enroll in workshops or examinations during the designated enrollment period.  
     [Source: [HKICPA Timetable](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Become-a-Hong-Kong-CPA/Qualification-Programme/Timetable)]

4. **Attend Workshops and Exams**:
   - Participate in the required workshops and sit for the exams as per the published schedule.  
     [Source: [HKICPA Timetable](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Become-a-Hong-Kong-CPA/Qualification-Programme/Timetable)]

5. **Pay Fees**:
   - Ensure timely payment of all applicable fees, which are non-refundable and non-transferable.  
     [Source: [HKICPA Fees](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Membership/Registration/Practising-Certificate/Practising-Certificate-Examinations)]

6. **Submit Authentic Documents**:
   - Provide accurate and truthful copies of all required documents. Misrepresentation may lead to legal consequences.  
     [Source: [HKICPA Application](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en/Become-a-Hong-Kong-CPA/New-QP/Application-and-registration)]

7. **Stay Updated**:
   - Regularly check the HKICPA website for updates on deadlines, schedules, and other important information.  
     [Source: [HKICPA Official Website](https://www.hkicpa.org.hk/en)]

For further assistance, you can contact HKICPA directly through their official channels.

question_en: What's new on China's Announcement on the Revision of the 'Administrative Measures for Departure Tax Refunds for Overseas Travelers? (Search and Answer)
answer_en:
China has recently revised its 'Administrative Measures for Departure Tax Refunds for Overseas Travelers' to enhance the tax refund process for foreign tourists. Here are the key updates:

1. **Eligibility and Process**:
   - Overseas travelers, including those from Hong Kong, Macao, and Taiwan, can claim VAT refunds if they depart within 17 days of purchasing tax-refundable goods.
   - The minimum purchase amount for eligibility is 500 yuan (about $73.1) per transaction, with a cumulative cap of 50,000 yuan (about $7,313). [Source: [China Tax Administration](https://www.chinatax.gov.cn/eng/c101269/c5156620/content.html)]

2. **Instant Tax Refund Service**:
   - Pilot stores, such as Wangfujing Department Store in Beijing, offer an "instant tax refund" service, allowing travelers to receive refunds directly at the store instead of the airport. [Source: [China Tax Administration](https://www.chinatax.gov.cn/eng/c101269/c5156620/content.html)]

3. **Regional Implementation**:
   - The policy is implemented nationwide, with regions like Beijing leading the effort. Since 2015, Beijing has had 538 pilot stores, generating over 930 million yuan in sales and issuing nearly 83 million yuan in refunds. [Source: [China Tax Administration](https://www.chinatax.gov.cn/eng/c101269/c5156620/content.html)]

4. **General Guidelines**:
   - Foreign tourists can claim VAT refunds for purchases above 200 yuan at designated tax-refund shops, processed at departure ports. [Source: [China Tax Administration](https://www.chinatax.gov.cn/eng/c101280/c5099665/content.html)]

5. **Policy Enhancements**:
   - The State Taxation Administration has simplified procedures and expanded the number of participating stores and regions to encourage inbound spending. [Source: [China Tax Administration](https://www.chinatax.gov.cn/eng/)]

For the most detailed and up-to-date information, refer to official announcements from the [State Taxation Administration](https://www.chinatax.gov.cn/eng/).
